TopicTitle: Cloud configurations for Outer Planets Mod [Last Update: 2015.09.23]

Articles.Content: The Tekto Lightning file does not appear to be downloadable from Mega. Does anybody else have the same problem?

Hello there! First, you're awesome, and these packs are awesome

I'm having a bit of a hiccup right now. I've installed the Astronomer-interstellar cloud pack, and the rings of Sarnus have turned bright white!

What have I done wrong?

Thanks!

> 
> The Tekto Lightning file does not appear to be downloadable from Mega. Does anybody else have the same problem?

I had no trouble with the MEGA download, it just takes a while. Anyways I added a 2nd host (TinyUpload) for the Tekto Lightning to the OP and below. 

Download from TinyUpload: [OPM-All-TektoLightning-0-1](http://s000.tinyupload.com/?file_id=35500339315598935901)

> 
> Hello there! First, you're awesome, and these packs are awesome
> I'm having a bit of a hiccup right now. I've installed the Astronomer-interstellar cloud pack, and the rings of Sarnus have turned bright white!
> 
> What have I done wrong?
> 
> Thanks!

Thanks, I'm glad you like it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I wasn't able to reproduce your problem in my setup (Windows, OpenGL, KSP x86 1.0.2, OPM1.7-beta2, EVE-7-4). What setup do you use? Are you using other mods? If you do I'd recommend to try a fresh install without other mods. 

General stuff: The glow-effects around the OPM Moons are a bit screwed up and from Wal and Tal there is Z-fighting around Urlum. I will fix that in the future but it could take some time.

*"The file you are trying to download is no longer available."*

It appears that all the files hosted on MEGA are gone. All of the download links return the same error.

i have issue tekto cloud look like this

![FKltVlw.png](http://i.imgur.com/FKltVlw.png)

When HyperEdit'ing my craft to Tekto orbit (ATM, AVP Int, OPM, SME):

    [EXC 06:39:44.890] UnityException: Texture 'BoulderCo/Clouds/Textures/detaileve1' is not readable, the texture memory can not be accessed from scripts. You can make the texture readable in the Texture Import Settings.    Clouds.CloudParticle.Update (UnityEngine.Texture2D tex)    Clouds.VolumeSection.Update ()    Clouds.VolumeManager.Update (Vector3 pos)    Clouds.CloudLayer.UpdateParticleClouds (Vector3 WorldPos)    Clouds.Clouds.Update ()

Lightning works. PlanetShine doesn't (craft is still dark). That file which is referenced in exception is in place, I can see kinda white square when opening it with viewer. What can be wrong? Maybe I'm just over the top RAM-wise?

Edit: yeah, in OpenGL mode there's no exception, but ringed planets are awful (rings are not translucent and are making them partially pink). So I guess that's RAM issue... Grrrrr.

I've read of people reporting the pink error being related to corrupted ATM files

Basically if atm crashes you should delete files with 0 Mb size and probably also the file atm crashed on

Idk if this can help

That looked like the RAM issue after all. I rescaled many textures to 1/2 of their size with XnView and - no more problem.

Also, will link that [post describing small troubles with PlanetShine .cfg's (old, obsolete format)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104280-1-0-2-Outer-Planets-Mod-%281-7-Beta-2%29-Wal-playable-atmospheres-balanced-and-much-more-17-May?p=2003230&viewfull=1#post2003230) here, just in case it's **this** mod which messed it (I'm not sure).

I for some reason can't seem to get the clouds to show up. Using the interstellar version. Have everything installed they just seem to not want to load for some reason.

Only discrepancy i can spot is that your download for interstellar doesnt say v2, Possibly thats why?

Edit : Turns out i had a .cfg file from KSRPC in there as well and the saved cloud configurations somehow messed it up, removing them and leaving the identical default section fixed the problem.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-16T03:58:08Z" title="06/16/2015 03:58  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 16, 2015</time> by Subcidal**
I can't get clouds to show up at all. Using EVE config for simplicity. Regular EVE mod works but config doesn't. Running 64-bit computer and 32-bit ksp.

> 
> I can't get clouds to show up at all. Using EVE config for simplicity. Regular EVE mod works but config doesn't. Running 64-bit computer and 32-bit ksp.

So you see the clouds around the stock bodys but not around the Outer Planets? Do you use [EVE 7-4](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905-0-23-5-7-2-EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements-NEW!-VolumetricClouds!) ? The [Overhaul](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100857-WIP-EVE-%28Environmental-Visual-Enhancements%29-Overhaul) is not supported at the moment. The configs and textures should look like [this](https://i.imgur.com/ixnaXE0.jpg). If one of the shown textures is not located in 'GameData/BoulderCo/Clouds/Textures' it is possible that no clouds will show up around the Outer Planets.

Sorry I took so long. First and second question: yes. I also don't use the overhaul. The only difference (probably should have mentioned this in my first post) is that I have duna sand storms installed: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905-0-23-5-7-1-EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements-NEW%21-VolumetricClouds%21?p=1070777&viewfull=1#post1070777](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905-0-23-5-7-1-EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements-NEW%21-VolumetricClouds%21?p=1070777&viewfull=1#post1070777)

Going to test to see if that is the problem soon. Thanks for the help.

I got it to work ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif). Turns out the problem was the tekto lighting which I assumed wouldn't be a problem (stupid me, also I don't care much for the lighting anyway so no big deal). Duna sandstorms is also compatible.

**Configs for EVE, KSPRC, AVP-EoO and AVP-Int updated!**

**Outer Planets Mod with** **Environmental Visual Enhancements**:

[![057gqvl.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/057gqvl.jpg)](https://imgur.com/a/LQ1a6)

Klick on the image to view imgur album.

**Download:**

MEGA: [OPM-EVE-config-0-5](https://mega.co.nz/#%21K8EQGbaR%210YRVeqVBGHCCBZ4JeTq1wSYhgL79cIg4GP7bzcQM0NY)

TinyUpload: [OPM-EVE-config-0-5](http://s000.tinyupload.com/?file_id=38793683319395981867)

**Installation:** Install [OPM](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104280), [Kopernicus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114649) and [EVE-7-4](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905). Copy the 'GameData' folder from the zip file into the KSP directory.

**Notes:** No auroras. No glow effects on moons.

**Outer Planets Mod with KSP Renaissance Compilation**:

[![HKF4Gc5.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/HKF4Gc5.jpg)](https://imgur.com/a/dYNqw)

Klick on the image to view imgur album.

**Download:**

MEGA: [OPM-KSPRC-config-0-5](https://mega.co.nz/#%21uolzBb7T%21RmVHezSFKVhEcGfQ2WU5rkBzOp_bSYm30coXaCOJ46E)

TinyUpload: [OPM-KSPRC-config-0-5](http://s000.tinyupload.com/?file_id=02008887692349549263)

**Installation:** Install [OPM](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104280), [Kopernicus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114649) and [KSPRC](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76972). Copy the 'GameData' folder from the zip file into the KSP directory.

**Outer Planets Mod with** Astronomer's Visual Pack - Edge of Oblivion:

[![ZpBlkmR.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/ZpBlkmR.jpg)](https://imgur.com/a/hIhFR)

Klick on the image to view imgur album.

**Download:**

MEGA: [OPM-EoO-config-0-5](https://mega.co.nz/#%21SwVynYZZ%21lU12Dz2wKaa1FX1JzJtPNolrj7MS6lH2jE1m0Z7FumE)

TinyUpload: [OPM-EoO-config-0-5](http://s000.tinyupload.com/?file_id=85491520265096937372)

**Installation:** Install [OPM](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104280), [Kopernicus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114649), [EVE-7-4](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905) and [AVP-EoO](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/89138). Copy the 'GameData' folder from the zip file into the KSP directory.

**Outer Planets Mod with** Astronomer's Visual Pack - Interstellar:

[![Owlg2k3.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/Owlg2k3.jpg)](https://imgur.com/a/fQxVf)

Klick on the image to view imgur album.

**Download:**

MEGA: [OPM-Int-config-0-5](https://mega.co.nz/#%21ngFEBRKJ%21FQ14KgPz-SvvH1zJRS5F5MAmhIUzvGphyyJPz0JQjUc)

TinyUpload: [OPM-Int-config-0-5](http://s000.tinyupload.com/?file_id=04226952738396712715)

**Installation:** Install [OPM](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104280), [Kopernicus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114649), [EVE-7-4](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905) and [AVP-Int](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102145). Make sure 'Auroras' and 'Clouds for Eve & Jool' is installed! Copy the 'GameData' folder from the zip file into the KSP directory.

> 
> ########## 0-5
> 
> All:
> 
> - Urlums colors adjusted to look more like the OPM texture.
> 
> - Urlums CloudLayer heights increased to reduce Z-fighting. 
> 
> - Glow effects on the GasGiants are 'thicker' to create a smooth transition from planet to space (since there is no AA with OpenGL).
> 
> - Tekto config replaced with the original Tekto config from OPM 1.5.5 for AVP-Interstellar to match the concept better. Some small adjustments but it's mostly the original file.
> 
> EVE-pack:
> 
> - Removed glow-effects on moons to match stock bodys.
> 
> KSPRC:
> 
> - Reworked old glow-effects on moons to fit the KSPRC-style better.
> 
> - Added glow-effects to Hale, Priax and Tal.
> 
> AVP-EoO:
> 
> - Added glow-effects to Hale, Priax and Tal.
> 
> AVP-Int:
> 
> - Added glow-effects to Hale, Priax and Tal.

> 
> I plan to update the configs for Sigma Mod Expansion (full version) next. Like OPM I'll start with EVE, KSPRC, EoO and Int.
> 
> If there is interest in updated/modified BA configs please pm me or leave a comment. Otherwise they will not be updated.

the issue is i was landing tekto weird clouds lines going on

> 
> the issue is i was landing tekto weird clouds lines going on

I assume you see something like [this](https://i.imgur.com/MRBgajU.jpg). I don't know why it happens sometimes but there is an easy fix for that:

1. Press ' m ' to enter map-mode.

2. Press ' Alt + N ' to bring up EVEs config-window.

3. Klick on ' [Reset to Save](https://i.imgur.com/Iq6V1rm.jpg) ' (needs to be done in map-view!).

4. Press ' m ' again to exit mapview and [the clouds should be normal](https://i.imgur.com/1o1jeib.jpg).

Hope this helps, but if not or this is not the problem you encounter, tell me. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
